"Attachment in Adulthood" does include case studies and examples throughout the book to illustrate key concepts and ideas. The authors use real-life examples to help readers understand how attachment patterns can play out in different types of relationships and in response to different life events. The case studies used in the book include examples of individuals with secure, anxious, and avoidant attachment styles, as well as examples of couples and families.

For example, the book describes a case of a woman named Sarah who has an anxious attachment style and struggles with feelings of insecurity and jealousy in her romantic relationships. Through therapy, she is able to learn how to regulate her emotions and communicate more effectively with her partner, which ultimately leads to an improvement in her relationship. Another case study in the book is about a man named Alex who has an avoidant attachment style and has difficulty getting close to others. The book describes how he learns to become more self-aware of his attachment patterns and how to open up to others in a healthy way.

The case studies used in the book are meant to provide readers with a more concrete understanding of how attachment patterns can manifest in real life and how they can be addressed through therapy and other interventions. They also help to illustrate the complexities of attachment and how different factors can influence attachment patterns.
